newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Car parts firm Wanxiang 1996 profit up.
newsitem.headline: Car parts firm Wanxiang 1996 profit up.

text.p: Zhejiang-based car parts maker Wanxiang Qianchao Co Ltd on Tuesday reported a 40.4 percent rise in 1996 net profit on sales.

Wangxiang's net profit rose to 55.75 million yuan in 1996 compared with 39.71 million in the previous year based on Chinese accounting standards, the company said in an annual report published in the Shenzhen-based Securities Times.
Turnover rose 99.7 percent to 456.15 million yuan last year from 228.45 million yuan in 1995, the statement said.
Net profits grew less than turnover because the company put took over several car parts makers in 1996, an official told Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin.

The company's board of directors proposed to distribute two bonus shares and a cash dividend of 0.8 yuan for every 10 shares, which needs the approval of shareholders at a meeting scheduled for May 15, the company statement said.
Shareholders will also vote on a plan to make a three-for-10 rights issue and use the money to improve production technology.
